hi and welcome you're listening to the
x22 report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1350 1a and today's date is
August 7th 2017 and the title of the
episode is new report finds the economy
never recovered it is one big illusion
let's get into the economic collapse
financial news now over the many years
we've been watching the stock market
move up and now it's twenty-two thousand
points which actually means absolutely
nothing the stock market has nothing to
do with the economy whatsoever the stock
market right now is completely
manipulated to keep all eyes off of what
is really happening in the economy and
in the meantime what the Fed is doing it
is basically setting everything up for
this gigantic crash and what they're
doing right now is they're removing a
lot of the tools they've used to
forecast recession now normally they
don't come out and tell you that there's
a recession coming because their tools
are telling you this they keep that on
the side because they know exactly what
is happening in the economy they know
exactly when a recession is coming but
what they're broadcasting out to the
public is don't worry we see nothing
everything is great put your money in
the market put your money in real estate
put your money over here up to the very
last minute and then all of a sudden
everything falls apart and they say wow
where this come from we have no clue and
what is happening right now a lot of
financial analysts a lot of individuals
corporations they're looking at the
economy and they're going back eight
years and they're saying well you know
something's not right we're seeing all
these different things occur but the
market keeps going up we're not seeing
the sales when I've seen the revenue
we're not seeing the tax receipts
we're networking retail closed down
we're seeing housing hitting the top now
everything's starting to move down and
something is wrong so one of these
individuals tom kean he created an
indicator that tells us the breadth of
the market now while a job as we know is
a job I mean you could just say yes
there are jobs out there but then you
have to go a little bit deeper and you
need to find out what type of job it
really is because each job is completely
different each job has a different
strengths each job pays a different
amount each job is either a part-time
it's a temporary
job is a full-time job and he went and
he looked at this and he said well we
have major problems here
now if total growth is strong but is the
result of only a few sectors the breadth
of the oval the overall market is weak
now this typically provides us with a
signal on where the overall market is
heading now this brings us to this
indicator that he built over the past
years and it is the labor market breadth
which seeks to measure the aggregate
health of the labor market by looking at
all different subcomponents so as we
know Friday the employment numbers came
out the report showed that there were
two hundred nine thousand new jobs
beating estimates of one hundred and
eighty three and the labor market
breadth fell to an unsafe cycle low and
when you look at the graph that he
provided yes this is exactly what has
happened so the headline numbers as they
always normally are they make them look
great they massage them they tell you
things are fantastic they look strong
but the subcomponents well they all
continues to slow which is not in good
sign a good indicator of strength in the
market now we can definitely see this in
retail and he points this out in this
chart and during the height of the
market we were seeing retail trade
around two to three percent we are below
zero right now
actually during the Great Recession
right before the Great Recession hit we
were hitting around two percent and we
dropped to negative six percent so right
now in this incredible recovery that
they started back in 2009 we are below
zero right now that doesn't make any
sense and if we look at other
information we can see that again this
follows through like arts entertainment
recreation again at
height of the market before the Great
Recession what do we see we were around
4% where are we today we are at 1% and
remember all these trajectories are
heading downward they're declining
they're not moving up healthcare which
has slowed materially over the past four
months
well again at the height of the market
we are around 3% we are now declining
and we're at 2% now remember Obamacare
boosted this up to make us believe and
think that everything was great they
were able to manipulate the numbers and
they kept doing this and now since
there's no manipulation you can see what
is happening now again we saw the

bust
they were completely imploding on

to happen because people are looking at
health care saying listen I just can't
afford this why can't they for this
because they don't have the income they

seeing right now once again when we're
looking at the labor market breadth
we're starting to see or we have been
seeing it for a long time that wages and
salaries are dropping now there is a
six-month lag on this but when we look
back in time we can see that according
to the scale right before the Great
Recession we were at 90 percent during
2008 it dropped down to 60 percent and
then boom it went down all the way to 5
percent the Fed was able to pump this
back up to 90 percent we are now around
25 percent and dropping fast so this
tells us that the labor market breadth
the breadth of the market well it's not
doing well now something very
interesting happened today and we can
see that the Fed is definitely setting
it up and trying to hide all of their
information all their indicators
everything that they're looking at and
they're trying to say we don't need it
anymore now this is very interesting now
this indicator and we've looked at this
before in other reports and I hate to
say it it's been very accurate but they
don't publicize this out in the
mainstream media they kind of keep this
hidden in the background they don't
really refer to it and it's the Fed
labor market condition index and when we
look at it we can see that they can
accurately predict when a recession is
going to hit and they've done this going
all the way back into the 80s they used
it in the 90s they used it in 2001 they
used it in 2008 and when you look at
this you can see that yes recession
recession recession recession now the
Fed is out there and they are saying
well you know something we really don't
need this tool anymore it really doesn't
work there's no reason for it it looks
like the government they have the data
so we really don't need this now to me
what they're doing right now is they're
basically getting rid of all the tools
that actually show what the real economy
is doing just like they didn't want to
show the money supply anymore what they
start to do is they start to hide all
these things so you really don't know
what's going on now of course those in
government they're putting out this fake
data now the Fed is going to say well
we've been just going along with this
data and this is the same data that's
been used since going all the way back
and it's been manipulated since 2008 so
you can see what they're doing right now
they're setting all of this up and
they're going to say hey listen we have
been just following what the government
has been saying they've been feeding us
the employment numbers they've been
feeding us the GDP numbers they've been
feeding us all this information and
they're telling us from their
statistical information that everything
is fine we don't have our indicators
anymore because we felt we didn't need
them anymore because the government was
doing such a great job so they're
already setting this up now remember the
Federal Reserve has nothing to do with
the government they're separate and
apart they're a standalone corporation
and again they know this system is
coming down then
it's falling apart and they don't want
to be blamed for this so they're setting
this up to blame another entity another
person or maybe another country so we
can see this is exactly what they're
doing now there is a new study that is
out there and they studied the Great
Recession which by the way we're still
in we're in a recession we're heading
into a depression and what they've been
looking at is that well we really never
got out of the Great Recession now the
Great Recession was unprecedented in
terms of severity of its impact on and
duration of the impact for any period
since 1947 the Great Recession is the
only period in the u.s. modern history
when the long-term trend path of real
GDP per capita shifted permanently below
historical trend now the Roosevelt
Institute they did a little bit of
research and what they found was the
output remains a full 15 percent below
the pre 2007 trend line a gap that is
getting wider net narrower over time now
the research note present evidence on
structural decline in labor productivity
growth alongside the evidence that this
decline is inconsistent with pre 2007
trends the effect of the Great Recession
in terms of potential output and actual
output growth trends labor productivity
and wages appear to be permanent in
nature and what they're saying is that
this new trend that they're seeing well
everything is declining and getting
lower the output the GDP numbers they're
not improving in other words the new
normal of post 2007 recovery implies
permanently lower output and income and
they're stating that we've never escaped
the Great Recession
there has been no improvement in the
economy whatsoever this economy has been
built on stimulus it's not by the people
it's not by man you
factoring it's not by producing and
exporting it was created and maintained
only on stimulus it's almost like
looking at someone that works out and
instead of doing it naturally using food
using weights working out everyday they
decide to take steroids and they use
this drug and they use it for a long
period of time and it looks great but
what happens is you end up with
complications it starts to backfire on
you things start to happen to your body
this is what's happening in the economy
it looks great we've been on these
steroids for this period of time
well now we're starting to see all the
problems of these steroids appear and as
it appears and as we continually break
down it's just going to get worse this
is why the central banks around the
world this is why they're discontinuing
stimulus this is why they're making this
announcement they might be doing it
covertly because they know if they
completely remove it the whole system
just falls apart because they realize
they've used stimulus to the max right
now and they know it's having no effect
on the economy whatsoever and if the
government and the governments around
the world are coming out with their
statistical numbers showing that the
economy is at almost full employment and
the economy looks great people are
wondering why do we still have stimulus
if the economy is completely fine and
this is why they're talking about
unwinding this is why they're talking
about raising the interest rates this is
why they're talking about all this and
again this is a lot of talk because they
realize the world is saying okay what is
going on here right now we've been doing
stimulus for you know eight years now do
we still need it now of course the Fed
is coming on say no we don't need it
anymore
but it looks like they are maneuvering
to set it up to show
that hey it wasn't our fault that the
economy came down it must have been
Trump it must have been Russia it must
have been China it must have been
everyone else except the central banking
system because what they want to do is
they want to restart this entire system
now China's reserves they're continually
declining as capital outflows accelerate
and what we're seeing is a lot of
countries they're starting to remove
their reserve dollars from their banking
system and the reason for this is
because they're they don't want to be
exposed to the dollar when it goes down
and we can see this is why they've been
selling off some Treasuries yes they
purchase some Treasuries but they sell
it off and they purchase gold Russia's
doing the same thing they're also
trading not using the dollar so they
don't really need the dollar for trade
they don't need to purchase oil and this
is another reason why the dollar is
going to come floating back to United
States because a lot of countries don't
need this dollar so we're already seeing
this trend and it's continuing it has
not stopped whatsoever because what
we're seeing right now is this complete
set up the Fed is setting it up they're
just continuing their tools we can see
that this new study is showing that yeah
we've never recovered whatsoever it's
one gigantic illusion and from
everything that we're looking at at all
these different indicators the only
thing the Fed has going for them right
now is the stock market and they've been
using this for a very long time the
corporate media has been using this very
for a very long time saying that this is
the breadth of the market and we know
that this is not the breadth of the
market
we know that this is one gigantic
illusion and when this whole thing falls
apart well it's going to be disaster now
the market might never fall apart think

might see corporations lay off even more
people we might see strip malls closed
we might see commercial real estate
we're these large buildings they're just

the economy is continually deteriorating
you might see the food stamp money going
out to individuals where they're taking
on more saying instead of 47 million it

market has no bearing on what the

who are not prepared they're going to be

everything is fine and when it
completely falls apart there's going to

listen everyone thanks a lot for
